required_header.download_date: ClinicalTrials.gov processed this data on November 19, 2021
required_header.link_text: Link to the current ClinicalTrials.gov record.

clinical_study.brief_title: Determinants of the Level of Anti-SARS-CoV-2 IgG ANTibodiEs After Vaccination Study
clinical_study.official_title: Determinants of the Level of Anti-SARS-CoV-2 IgG ANTibodiEs After Vaccination (DANTE-SIRIO 7) Study

brief_summary.textblock: Great expectations to control the pandemic are placed in vaccines against COVID-19. Currently, the four COVID-19 vaccines approved in the European Union. We have designed the study assessing the anti-SARS-CoV-2 IgG antibody titer after vaccination cycle the BNT162b2 vaccine in several time points relating these results to the COVID-19 history and severity of symptoms during the disease and after the first and second vaccine dose

detailed_description.textblock: The study includes healthy, unselected volunteers from the staff of Antoni Jurasz University Hospital No.1 in Bydgoszcz and students of Collegium Medicum, Nicolaus Copernicus University. To meet the inclusion criteria patients will have to be vaccinated with two doses of the BNT162b2 vaccine. The assessment of the anti-SARS-CoV-2 IgG antibody titer at several time points in each participant. Fresh serum samples were used to measure SARS-CoV-2 IgG on the Siemens Atellica system (Siemens Healthineers, Erlangen, Germany). Results of SARS-CoV-2 IgG were given as U/ml, whereby the cut-off for positivity was defined as ≥1.0 U/ml.

primary_outcome.measure: the anti-SARS-CoV-2 IgG antibody concentration 3 months after vaccination cycle with the BNT162b2 vaccine
primary_outcome.description: evaluation of anti-SARS-CoV-2 IgG antibody concentration 3 months after 2-dose vaccination with BNT162b2 vaccine

secondary_outcome.measure: the anti-SARS-CoV-2 IgG antibody concentration 6, 9 and 12 months after two-dose vaccination cycle
secondary_outcome.description: evaluation of anti-SARS-CoV-2 IgG antibody concentration at particular time points in 2-dose vaccination schedule

secondary_outcome.measure: the anti-SARS-CoV-2 IgG antibody concentration immediately before, 1 and 3 months after the third vaccine dose
secondary_outcome.description: evaluation of anti-SARS-CoV-2 IgG antibody concentration at particular time points after 3rd dose of vaccine

secondary_outcome.measure: local and/or systemic adverse reactions after vaccination
secondary_outcome.description: verification of any adverse events occurrence based on survey filled by participants on each visit
verification of COVID-19 based on survey filled by participants on each visit

arm_group.arm_group_label: participants willing to receive a 3-dose vaccination schedule
arm_group.description: participants who received a 2-dose vaccination schedule, willing to receive a 3rd dose

arm_group.arm_group_label: participants unwilling to receive a 3rd dose of vaccination
arm_group.description: participants who received a 2-dose vaccination schedule, unwilling to receive a 3rd dose

intervention.intervention_name: assessment of the anti-SARS-CoV-2 IgG antibody titer in 3-dose schedule
intervention.description: evaluation of anti-SARS-CoV-2 IgG antibodies in patients after 2-dose vaccination schedule willing to receive a 3rd dose of vaccine
intervention.arm_group_label: participants willing to receive a 3-dose vaccination schedule

intervention.intervention_name: assessment of the anti-SARS-CoV-2 IgG antibody titer in 2-dose schedule
intervention.description: evaluation of anti-SARS-CoV-2 IgG antibodies in patients after 2-dose vaccination schedule unwilling to receive a 3rd dose of vaccine
intervention.arm_group_label: participants unwilling to receive a 3rd dose of vaccination

study_pop.textblock:
The study includes healthy, unselected volunteers from the staff of Antoni Jurasz University Hospital No.1 in Bydgoszczand students of Collegium Medicum, Nicolaus Copernicus University.
Approximately1000 adult participants are planned to be included in the study

criteria.textblock:
Inclusion Criteria:
- Provision of informed consent to study
- Age ≥ 18 years
- Receiving two doses of the BNT162b2 vaccine
Exclusion Criteria:
- patients who did not complete 2-dose vaccination schedule
- patients who received any other vaccine than BNT162b2
- patients considered by investigator to be unable to cooperate

facility.name: Cardiology Department, Dr. A. Jurasz University Hospital
